title: [Epidemiology] Bacteria and fungi with the ability to withstand the drugs meant to kill them are now causing 1.2 million deaths every year -- more than malaria, according to a global study. This represents a big jump from previous estimates of 700,000 deaths a year.
[Neuroscience] Cannabinoid receptors in the brain appear to play a key role in the euphoric experience known as the “runner’s high”
